lines.text:
[flirting with a woman in the lobby]
You're gonna be fine, don't worry.
She's not sick.
curing healthy people.

[repeated line]
Stay back of the white line!

[about mopping to the janitor]
I know you've been doing it your way since you got here, but your way doesn't get into the corners.
Who goes into the corners?
Germs, Richard. Please, just do it my way.
You're the boss.
I'd like you to do it because you agree with me, not because I'm the boss.
Whatever you say.
Richard, that's the wrong attitude.
Look, Doc, I get the least amount of pay for the dirtiest job in the hospital. Let me have my attitude. I know it's rotten, but it's all I've got.
Why did you give that man a tetanus shot for biting his own tongue?
He didn't bit his own tongue. The teeth marks were going the wrong way.

[both laughing]
Well, I thought his wife looked a little guilty!

[about Dr. Sheinfeld]
You didn't fire him?
No.
I'll do it.
Both of us.
What?
You have to fire both of us.
Oh, now, Eve, please...

I'm serious, John. You hired me to run this ER and I will run it as best I can. I grant you we have to make money, but the decisions on how have to be mine or you don't need me! I will say who works in this department and who doesn't. If you can't live with that, I'll have to resign.
Well, since you put it that way, I'll live with it. For now.
